title: Mardi Gras Fast Facts
text:
Photos: Photos: Mardi Gras celebrations in New Orleans Mardi Gras celebrations in New Orleans – Revelers parade through the French Quarter during Mardi Gras celebrations in New Orleans on Tuesday, February 12. Hide Caption 1 of 11

Photos: Photos: Mardi Gras celebrations in New Orleans Mardi Gras celebrations in New Orleans – Flag boy Leroy Ross of the Wild of the Nation Mardi Gras Indians sings in front of the Backstreet Cultural Museum in New Orleans. Hide Caption 2 of 11

Photos: Photos: Mardi Gras celebrations in New Orleans Mardi Gras celebrations in New Orleans – Nick Mahshie and Anne Devalence, dressed as "Abe Lincoln and his mistress," participate in Mardi Gras celebrations in the Faubourg Marigny. Hide Caption 3 of 11

Photos: Photos: Mardi Gras celebrations in New Orleans Mardi Gras celebrations in New Orleans – Ed Reed of the Baltimore Ravens walks the parade route after getting off a float during the Krewe of Zulu parade. Hide Caption 4 of 11

Photos: Photos: Mardi Gras celebrations in New Orleans Mardi Gras celebrations in New Orleans – A reveler dangles beads off a balcony on Bourbon Street. Hide Caption 5 of 11

Photos: Photos: Mardi Gras celebrations in New Orleans Mardi Gras celebrations in New Orleans – Lorraine Summers of New Orleans, dressed as Medusa, celebrates Mardi Gras in the French Quarter. Hide Caption 6 of 11

Photos: Photos: Mardi Gras celebrations in New Orleans Mardi Gras celebrations in New Orleans – Sunpie Barnes, big chief of the Northside Skull & Bones gang, walks around the Treme neighborhood of New Orleans on Tuesday morning. Hide Caption 7 of 11

Photos: Photos: Mardi Gras celebrations in New Orleans Mardi Gras celebrations in New Orleans – Revelers in costume watch from a window at Mimi's bar as people gather on the street below. Hide Caption 8 of 11

Photos: Photos: Mardi Gras celebrations in New Orleans Mardi Gras celebrations in New Orleans – Kamil del Toro, dressed as a Day of the Dead sugar skull, participates in celebrations in the French Quarter. Hide Caption 9 of 11

Photos: Photos: Mardi Gras celebrations in New Orleans Mardi Gras celebrations in New Orleans – Flag boy Leroy Ross of the Wild of the Nation Mardi Gras Indians crosses Claiborne Avenue in New Orleans. Hide Caption 10 of 11
description: Read CNN's Fast Facts about Mardi Gras, a celebration held the day before the fasting season of Lent begins on Ash Wednesday.
